meanings.definition: To put an end to; crush.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to scotch the rumors spreading around the school.
meanings.sent2: The hero scotched the evil plans of the villain.
meanings.sent3: The plan to have a surprise party was scotched when the birthday girl found out.
meanings.sent4: The team scotched their opponents' hopes of winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The detective scotched the criminal's escape with a clever trap.

meanings.sent1: He enjoyed sipping on a glass of scotch after a long day at work.
meanings.sent2: The bartender recommended trying the scotch from the top shelf.
meanings.sent3: The scotch on the rocks was the perfect way to unwind after a busy week.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the aged scotch filled the room with a rich scent.
meanings.sent5: She savored the smooth taste of the scotch as it warmed her from the inside.

meanings.sent1: He didn't even notice the scotch on his arm until it started stinging.
meanings.sent2: The scotch on her knee was a result of playing too rough with the dog.
meanings.sent3: The scotch on the table was a reminder of the DIY project gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: The scotch on his cheek was a souvenir from the tree-climbing adventure.
meanings.sent5: She covered the scotch on her finger with a bandage to protect it from getting infected.
